session_synopses.AD_BetrayedGrieflingFriend: Memnos is outraged after the player betrays the refugees in favour of the attacking goblins.
session_synopses.WarchiefGrumpy: Goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingOnGate: Arka talks to herself while manning the Grove's defences, working herself up for the imminent battle against attacking goblins. She mentions her dead friend Kanon and all the goblins she intends to kill in his name.
session_synopses.Pet002: After victory following a huge goblin attack on his home, a wolf feels satisfied with a job well done, but warns you not to ruin the peace..
session_synopses.AD_HalsinJoinsFight: AD that plays when Halsin joins the fight against the goblin raiders, after the player betrays the tieflings.
session_synopses.Servant004: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Elwyn is shaken - she's spent a long time worried about the safety of the grove, and had given up hope once the goblins arrived. After the goblins were defeated, she realises her fear had gotten the better of her.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeaderInstructions: Mol is looking over the valuables that have been gathered by her underlings and advises them as they prepare to journey to Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.TorturedAdventurer: Oneliner when we find the tortured adventurer sleeping in the grove during the attack on the den.
session_synopses.AD_LairDoor: The person behind the locked druid sanctum door (Marcoryl the druid servant) yells at Doni (grunting kid) to get lost.
session_synopses.RitualDruid002: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Kerrick feels ashamed for having participated in a ritual that would have driven the tieflings out, especially after having just fought beside them against the goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Prodigies: The prodigy and his brother and sister are having an argument about their role in the defense of the grove.
session_synopses.Sapper_003: a goblin carrying explosives in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAtBarricade: Asharak is on the gate with Kaldani, before the goblins attack. Surveying her work..
session_synopses.Trainer:
Asharak has been tasked with getting civilians prepared for war. He hopes having the player on their side might make the difference.
If the tiefling leader is dead, Asharak reluctantly steps into his shoes.
session_synopses.Trainee003: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.RaiderBossy: A goblin raider celebrates upon having successfully destroyed a shelter full of refugees. Jubilant and nasty.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: Kagha dialogue if Attack on Den has occurred. Various states included in this dialogue
session_synopses.PAD_DeadKids: Player finds dead tiefling children, killed by goblins, after assisting the goblins in a raid on the grove. NOTE: this dialog only triggers if players chose to side against the tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_LootingGoblins: Two goblins are looting the area near the cook and adventurer areas before burning it to the ground.
session_synopses.EntranceMeeting: Zevlor or Asharak are manning the wall of the grove, which is sealed up tight against a coming invasion. They're astonished to see an ally (the player) emerge from the trees and order their soldiers not to shoot.
session_synopses.Griefling: A tiefling preparing for the goblin assault on the grove - she's scared but excited about the attack because she sees it as a chance to avenge her friend, Kanon, who was killed by goblins earlier. She's trying to sound more sure of herself than she is.
session_synopses.RaiderViolent: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid001: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Aelar is still in a bit of a daze from chanting for so long. He doesn't quite believe everything that's happened.
session_synopses.RaiderHardy: A goblin taking part in a raid on a druid grove
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: Dialogue for the lazy bear sleeping next to the elevator after the den has been attacked.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndPotions: The warchief sees through the arsonists who failed to loot the storehouse and orders them to get to looting despite the fire.
session_synopses.EntranceMeetingWyll: Player returns to den after letting Wyll return beforehand. NOTE: A NARRATOR NODE IS REQUIRED IN THE FIRST NODE BECAUSE IT IS A SPEAKER SELECTION WITH A CINEMATIC.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove, in the event that the prodigy and co were convinced to stay.
session_synopses.RaiderCrafty: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.
session_synopses.AD_RaidersAtPool: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
session_synopses.LeaderKid: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
session_synopses.AD_CaringForOx: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.
session_synopses.AD_RikkaAndDoni: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.
session_synopses.ChefAndSon: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.GoblinLush: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_BossyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.
session_synopses.RaiderStupid: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Mule1: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.
session_synopses.Apprentice: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonPacking: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived
session_synopses.AD_CoweringStargazer: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.
session_synopses.BackupVictory: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..
session_synopses.Trainee001: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.
session_synopses.RaiderBold: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove
session_synopses.Sapper_001: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.
session_synopses.RaiderCunning: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight
session_synopses.AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.
session_synopses.AD_LoversOverTortured: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.
session_synopses.Tiefling010: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
session_synopses.RaiderFunny: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge
session_synopses.RaiderChieftain: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RaiderHefty: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Servant001: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.
session_synopses.AD_PotionRaiders: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.
session_synopses.Melee_001: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.AD_Sappers: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriend: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.
session_synopses.ParentA: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.
session_synopses.Refugee001: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.
session_synopses.AD_GettingArmed: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.
session_synopses.WarchiefBrave: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: Zevlor is tense - he's awaiting a long-expected attack on the grove, and the player is likely here to confirm it or perhaps even strike the first blow against him. Zevlor's usual tone is all stiff upper-lip, but at certain points we'll see the cracks start to form.
session_synopses.DruidGuard001: Jeorna, one of the druid grove's guards, reacts to their victory in defending their home. She may also react to the tiefling refugees having left.
session_synopses.Ranged_001: The goblins have just won a bloody victory over innocent civilians.
session_synopses.AD_CraftyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.AD_CharmedKidStory: Mirkon is a fallback, telling a story if the bard isn't present. He's excitedly telling the story about how he got caught by the harpies and the player rescued him.
session_synopses.AD_InstructionsForKids: Rikka is firmly giving instructions to children before they depart on a dangerous journey.
session_synopses.AD_DrowArrives: The drow commander is leading a group of goblins in an attack on some tiefling refugees. If the players have chosen to side with her and are already killing the tieflings when she arrives, she is amused that the player has taken the initiative; they're excellent evil allies.

VB_AtCorpses.speaker: Player
VB_AtCorpses.text: I wonder where they were going.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

session_synopses.VB_AtCorpses: Remarking on corpses on the road.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingCorpses: After encountering some dead adventurers in the forest, Aradin urges his remaining company to keep moving (only plays if he's not alone).
session_synopses.AD_AradinAndRemira: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerCleaningWound: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

1.speaker: Danis
1.text: I don't want to wait around here longer than we have to.

session_synopses.1: This is Danis' default dialogue if Bex is either occupied or dead, so it's a bit uneasy and tonally ambiguous without giving a strong indication of what's on his mind.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: Do you hear them? The birds. They're beautiful.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I've thought of nothing but goblins and tieflings for so long, I stopped listening.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's referring to her anxiety preventing her from listening to the birds in the grove.

AD_RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

AD_RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4.text: The grove isn't safe. Not anymore.
AD_RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_Ritual: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Elwyn is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Elwyn is conflicted - she knows why the ritual had to be stopped, but she's scared that they've been left defenceless.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Elwyn is calm but exhausted, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.The player always encounters Elwyn around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid1: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid3: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid4: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Elwyn was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Elwyn is preoccupied with the goblins - she's afraid that without the protection the ritual would have provided, they don't have a chance against them.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Elwyn is calm, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_002.text: So what's your side of the business?

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I'm the guard? So... don't steal anything! I'm watching you!

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Child being shaken by player. She struggles free, and a few trinkets fall to the groundNodeContext: Scared and in pain

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Escapes the player's grasp, runs away.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey, you're back. Here to trade?

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Hey there. You wanna buy one of my lucky rings? Bargain magic at good prices.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: Drop the act. I know about your little scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: That hurts. It's a great big scam.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: But okay, fine. Get out of here. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

Trainee3.speaker: Gan
Trainee3.text: This is boring. We should train against real goblins!

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: I saw you at the gates. You fight well.
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: All the trainees are getting added to the dialog on this nodeNodeContext: Teacher voice.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A few words for the kids? Spare a story or two?
Trainer.context: InternalNodeContext: The global flag checks if any kid failed to be includedNodeContext: lower, not for the ears of the children

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: They're just children - why are you teaching them to fight?

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: It's that or teach them to beg for their lives.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: The goblins will chase us to Baldur's Gate and these kids know it.

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: A warrior like you could lift their spirits.

Trainer.speaker: Player
Trainer.text: I'll lift their spirits by wiping out that whole camp of goblins by myself.
Trainer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spoken to trainer (overheard by kids)

Trainer.speaker: Asharak
Trainer.text: Thanks. I prefer when they smile.

Trainee2.speaker: Ide
Trainee2.text: Next time the goblins come, I'll be ready.

Trainee2.speaker: Wyll
Trainee2.text: Don't push it, kid. If you see trouble, then run. Only fight if you have to.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

AD_KidGuardReport.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.

PAD_AfterKid.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_AfterKid.text: This Zorru has encountered githyanki. I must find and question him.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterKid: Lae'zel avatar remarks on the kid who recognised her as a githyanki

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: See how you feel when your pack is empty - it'll be this or a handful of weeds.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards herself. NodeContext: Player has rudely turned down your food. You're annoyed and offended.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being a spoilt idiot.Sounds very annoyed now.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear sluggishly gets up. (It moves in scripting, after the dialogue has ended.)

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You could hold off a horde of goblins from this position.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Maybe - but we're not fighters. If they broke through, it'd be a massacre.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: slightly reassured but still anxious

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: The sooner we leave for Baldur's Gate, the better.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Hells, I didn't mean it that way. Halsin's important, but you're the first bit of good faith we've had since he left.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Keep your wits about you. Things are tense with the druids here.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *The squirrel lunges at your foot and bites it.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *You follow the squirrel's gaze to a pair of clumsy, ugly feet. Your own, on her territory.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *Looking around, 'her territory' extends from one end of the grove to another.*

Squirrel.speaker: Narrator
Squirrel.text: *The squirrel chitters scornfully as your foot whistles over her head.*
Squirrel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kicks and misses the squirrel

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: I'll t-tell you. Just stay back, all right?

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: They were on the road to Baldur's Gate, near the mountain p-pass.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: It saw us 'fore we saw it. Jammed its blade through Yul's belly, straight to the other side.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: And I just... I just ran.

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.context: NodeContext: Warning the player to get back.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: I chipped it on the evil thing. It was horrible.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Wait - you're big. You can get rid of the evil thing!

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.text: Follow me. But be ready for anything.
Rat.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'anything' - he's warning the player it could get dicy

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Glad you were here for those goblins. Picked one off yesterday, myself. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That should've killed her, but... she kept gasping. Clawing at the arrow.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking away absentmindedly, reliving the bad memories.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: Your first kill? Don't worry - it gets easier.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: That's what Zevlor said, too. I hope you're right.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: She's trying to be hopeful, but still has doubts.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: I want to help - I just didn't think it would feel like this.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Used to think the goblins'd kill us the second we set foot outside. But after hearing what you did at the gate...

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: ... well, I still think they'll kill us. But at least we can put up a fight.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: Try not to keel over with the first blade drawn.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Well, we came through Avernus. We might not look it, but we're tough.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Who knows, some of us might even make it to Baldur's Gate.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard10.text: With trained worgs on your scent? Not likely.

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: You are just a ray of sunshine, aren't you?

TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
TieflingGuard10.text: Thanks for your helpful feedback, but I think we're done here.

PAD_WolfStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_WolfStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Treefather, our turmoil is calmed.*

AD_TieflingGuard3.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3.text: What I'd do for some salt...
AD_TieflingGuard3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over cooking pot - cooking. NodeContext: Slightly gruff. Talking to herself.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: Another one. What are you under there, then? Ant? Aurochs?

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: The keepers of this place. They change their form to fit their need.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: They become birds, to hunt on the wing. Bears, to tear flesh with teeth. But for me - only oxen. Only same old hay.

Mule1.speaker: Bored Ox
Mule1.text: And I cannot even eat it, because the horned ones hide their shiny bits inside.

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Goblins. Druids. This grove is a death trap.

Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
Refugee1.text: Grab what you can and get out, that's my advice.

AD_Refugee4.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee4.text: Can't keep the goblins out forever. This is no fortress, and we're no warriors.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

AD_TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard8.text: Should be safe to travel now.

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard10: A Tiefling in the druid grove who's keen to banter and joke. She's a bit flirtatious, though there's an undercurrent of fear throughout it all. She's genuinely afraid that she's going to die, and her only coping mechanism is to joke about it - in this case offering to make a bet. She's looking for something to look forward to.RERECORD NOTES: All lines in that dialogue have been set to rerecord with a few line changes. Overall direction. she needs to a more tongue in cheek humorous delivery.
session_synopses.PAD_WolfStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3: Okta is leaning over her cooking pot, trying to make something edible as she mutters to herself.
session_synopses.Mule1: The ox is waiting in the cave while the tieflings decide whether to return to the road or not. He has been watching the druids in the grove below, and how they can change into any form they wish. He's wistful and sulky, wishing he could change his own shape from an ox to something less subservient.He can give us a hint about an item stashed in his hay.
session_synopses.AD_GruntingKid: General, casual grunt from grunting kid while he's under normal circumstances in the druid grove.
session_synopses.PAD_ElkStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee4: Waiting for an attack of goblins on the druid grove. On edge.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard8: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard8: Ikaron either comments on the fact that the goblins have been defeated, or that they tiefligns have already bene attacked.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.context: NodeContext: Concentrating, exerting himself - then flubbing it.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Swing, parry, strike - nngh. Damn, damn, damn!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing. Not looking at player.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No wonder you're struggling - you've no balance. Space your feet farther apart.
True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses.AD: Guex, a tiefling refugee, practices his swordplay on a wooden dummy. If he received pointers from the player, his efforts are improved. Otherwise, he stuggles.
session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: Oh, thank you, thank you. I thought I was going to die down here.
Captive.context: NodeContext: out of breath, words spilling out of him - he's just been rescued from goblins who were tormenting him

Captive.speaker: Player
Captive.text: I'm surprised the goblins didn't gut you on sight. Why didn't they?

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: They were asking questions - about a weapon.
Captive.context: NodeContext: confused, he doesn't know anything about this

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: I told them - the only weapons here are the ones the foulbloods brought.

Captive.speaker: Findal
Captive.text: I must tell the others what happened. Step careful - there are traps in these tunnels. And thank you again.
Captive.context: NodeContext: frantic - he's still getting his breath back after being attacked by goblins, and is preparing to leave

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Did some bleeding hearts show up to save the druid? I'll cut ya to pieces.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Warrior Gresh
node_data.text: Kill 'em!
node_data.context: NodeContext: shouting an order to other nearby goblins as he prepares to attack the player

AD_CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
AD_CapturedGoblin.text: They ain't as friendly as me. Not as clever either. Kill 'em.
AD_CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: sly, vicious on last two words

AD_Captive.speaker: Findal
AD_Captive.text: The little thieves would have picked the whole grove clean.
AD_Captive.context: NodeContext: muttering to himself as he searches through stolen goods

session_synopses.Captive: Slightly out of breath, recovering from panic.A druid who was held hostage by goblin intruders speaks to the players who freed him.
session_synopses: Reaction from Goblin Scouts if they're approached in the tunnels. They attack even if Sazza is present.
session_synopses.AD_Tracks: Player recognises goblin tracks and comments.
session_synopses.AD_CapturedGoblin: Sazza tells players to kill other goblins while she is being rescued from the grove
session_synopses.AD_Captive: ADs for druid scout when he returns to the tiefling kids' area and finds it full of stolen goods, after the tieflings are gone

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: That snake must be held accountable.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: By every star, by every vein on every leaf, she must.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: This has only happened because our true leader was taken from us.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: Kagha seems happy to rule the roost. Who's your real leader?

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Master Halsin. Perhaps goblin-caught, perhaps dead. He'd set... Mistress Kagha back in line. Hold her to task. Stop this damned ritual.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: More will die if the rite is finished. So many more, sent into a world gone mad...

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: If no one's looking for Halsin, I could do it.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Would you? I would give anything to see Halsin return home.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Your dismissal is no shield. Kagha will ensure all outsiders are driven from the grove.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Should you change your mind, head west. Halsin is an elf with the presence of a bear.

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The snake killed that girl in front of everyone. Is this grove worth a dead child?

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The longer we stay here, the closer we come to reaching the same fate.
PAD_KidDied.context: NodeContext: Karlach just watched some druids accidentally kill a tiefling girl. She's stunned.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

AD_OpposedPacified.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified.text: So much death. So little justice.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.AD_CallWolf: Silver, Rath's wolf companion, is wandering away from him. He calls the wolf back. Patient and affectionate tone.
session_synopses.PAD_KidDied: Reaction after Arabella, a tiefling child, is killed by the druid Kagha's serpent in the grove. Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who was in the dialog and had opportunity to stop it. (May have tried and failed or simply refrained from acting)Speaker 2 is an accompanying character, they may have an opinionated line regarding the outcome according to their own beliefs.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.AD_KaghaInCombat: Kagha has been outed and is now fighting the players with the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedPacified: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Player
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: Children? I haven't spoken to any children.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *Your words may be false, but they ring truer than Mol's tales. You're off the hook.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Player
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: Apologise. You were mistaken to touch their holy relic.
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.context: InternalNodeContext: No evidence was found. Can happen if everything that was stolen was stackable, e.g. gold, and was merged with existing stacks in the player's inventory

session_synopses.Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Wyll
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: Harsh. Remind me to stay on your good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: You were never on my good side.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

PAD_MuralHint.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_MuralHint.text: That mural... they look like Dark Justiciars.

session_synopses.PAD_MuralHint: Shadowheart notices the mural in the druid's grove.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Good try. But don't just swing all pell-mell.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Swing, count a beat, and swing again.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Would that we could speak freely, my ursine friend!
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Alas, I've never learned to converse with your kind.
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleading with theatrical, wistful flair

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Ah, my good friend!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you.NodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you. He's happy to see you, he has questions for you!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Forgive my surprise. It's rare to find your kind above ground. Rare and intriguing on a day already packed with intrigue!
node_data.context: NodeContext: polite and enthusiastic

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: You were at the gates just now, no? When the goblins came? You saw them up close?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's about to start quizzing you on what you saw. Eager.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: A few questions, if you please. There's no overstating my interest.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He wants to write down what you'll say. Enthusiastic.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine - ask your questions.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Glory! Now, then:
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's ready to write, quill to book.NodeContext: Player agreed to answer his questions. He's happy but also arrogant, like a rich old person saying 'you're an absolute DOLL' when you do a minor favor for them.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: How would you describe that particular batch of goblins? Size? Nature? Distinguishing qualities?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Quizzing the player, looking for info for his book. He's more professional here, curious.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You search your mind, successfully recalling various details of goblin behaviour.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Common variety goblins, led by a lasher and flanked by booyahgs.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: My! A scholar after my own heart. Spent much time among goblins?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The time was spent among books. I'm a student of the page.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Aha! I've always preferred experience to the second-hand accounts of lesser men. But to each their own!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Now I've a few more questions, if you don't mind.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: And the... dragon they had marching in the rear. Was it of the brass or silver variety?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Volo is bullshitting. There was no dragon and he knows it. But he's stating it to the player as though he believes it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Dragon...? There wasn't any dragon.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: 'Witnesses... failed... to... notice the... obvious... dragon...'
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scribbling in notebookNodeContext: Response to 'I told him there was no dragon.' Volo's sensationalizing again.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Last question, then you'll be quite free. Did the attackers rally to 'the Absolute' when they fell upon the gates?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's wrapping things up, in full journalism mode.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Yes - they called out the name like a war cry.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: They did, didn't they? Oh-ho, curious. Curious indeed.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Answers that yes, the goblins used the word 'Absolute'. He's very interested in this; very intrigued. Your confirmation is exactly what he wanted to hear.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: I've interrogated one - a captive in this very camp. She reports they've abandoned their god Maglubiyet in favour of someone called 'the Absolute'.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: The scandal!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hissed like he's just conveyed a very juicy bit of gossip

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Goblin superstition - not worth the ink and parchment.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.text: Just a moment - this man is recording my story.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.context: NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Bear.speaker: Narrator
Bear.text: *As the colourful man starts scribbling, the bear sneaks a quick look at the page.*
Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Volo is excited, writing on the page. The bear leans in to see what he's writing.

Bear.speaker: Narrator
Bear.text: *His brow furrows. Incomprehensible squiggles surround a crude sketch: a bear disembowelling a clutch of tieflings.*

session_synopses.AD: Volo will have some casual behavior around camp. One of these behaviors is to wander over to a druid's tame bear and try to talk to it.
session_synopses: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.
session_synopses.Bear: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

node_data.speaker: Tilses
node_data.text: You're the one who helped at the gate? Glad to have another sword - we might need it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up

session_synopses: A guard outside the prison who can greet the player on their way in/ out.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Stop it! You're not going to find the antidote.

Apprentice.speaker: Player
Apprentice.text: Then help me. Give me a chance to beat this.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I can't. I can't let you endanger this camp.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Please, just sit down. Make your prayers. Let things take their course.

session_synopses.Apprentice: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has done something to annoy her (ie. Stolen, damaged, or moved something she owned, or been caught trying to pick her pocket.) Nettie has poisoned the player, and is wary of you finding the antidote while looking around.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents.speaker: Player
Parents.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.Parents: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit. You did it.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just do it, before I cut out that profane tongue of yours.
False

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Better that than chance the damn curse. You got a plan C?

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The curse is cleared. You'll be perfectly safe.
False

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Cleared - just like that, huh? Well I'm not taking the chance. Any other ideas?

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just do it, before I cut out that profane tongue of yours.
True

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Fine, fine - I'm not looking for more trouble.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Won't be needing this poison, now that you've offed the pricks. Bet you'll find it handy, though.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gnome hands over poison vial.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: You're a good one. I won't forget it.

Saved.speaker: Skickpit
Saved.text: Shit. Still can't believe you got me out of there. Sorry I told you to piss off.

session_synopses: Skickpit has a foul mouth to match the duergar. He runs their errands for them and brings them drinks. You can ask if he wants freed, attack him, or leave him be.
session_synopses.Saved: Foul-mouthed elevator gnome has been saved and is now in the myconid circle.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *The cover proudly announces this book to be: 'Flumph Mating Rituals'.*
DisguisedJournal.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover
NodeContext: Flumph = FLUMF

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *If the drow's corpse is to be believed, it's something else entirely.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Player
DisguisedJournal.text: Try to peer through the illusion.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *Strain as you might, your eyes find nothing but an overly detailed description of the flumph's reproductive process.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and studies the text before them
