session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.
session_synopses.DisguisedJournal: This book is recovered from the body of Xargrim, a wizard searching for the Adamantine Forge. It contains instructions on how to operate the forge, but is disguised as a rather smutty "nature" textbook.Flumph = FLUMF.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

session_synopses.CINE_RaftApproaching: We see a raft with duergar approaching our raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

session_synopses.CINE_FromPLA: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using an elevator to get from the Zhentarim Hideout to the Underdark

session_synopses.Dead_Wizard: SwD with Dhourn (leader of the petrified Drow).You can learn from this dialog about:- Forge- Memory Crystal and Activation Word for it;- Xagrism (one of his frenemies)

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.
session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: At ease. Without magic, things feel so peaceful.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A quiet contentment settles in your chest. Perhaps a life without power would not be so terrible.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Whispers. Moans. Disharmony. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then, you see visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping myconid remains with their axes.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*they broke our peace. they killed our young*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*we laid waste to many. you bring yet another. you bring us the Rot*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Conjure tranquil memories in hopes of calming the sovereign.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the Rot festers. duergar remain. lakeward*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

session_synopses: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: You had our backs. Guess you True Souls ain't all bad.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: I mean, still don't like ya. But you're not a total gobshite. Bah. You buying?
Camp.context: NodeContext: Said roughly but with a tough of affection. 'Bah' cause greymon doesn't like talking about FEELINGS.

Camp.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Camp.text: Come back any time. I'll be here - enjoying the show.
Camp.context: NodeContext: Pleased at the grym scene before him

session_synopses.Camp: Default dialog for the captain of the raft at the duergar camp. In default state, he encourages you to talk to the sergeant, as he has already told you to do that in previous dialogue.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.FollowUp: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

AtPier_01.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
AtPier_01.text: Got my eye on you, gnome.

session_synopses.AtPier_01: Duergar guarding the lakeside enterance to Ketheric City. Extra mean to deep gnomes.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Just leave me, I said. You've done enough damage already.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

DwarvenAlchemist.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla

InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*it nourishes us all. the Circles, the drow - we drink of its essence*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.context: NodeContext: imply turning back with hand genstures but please keep it genralised.

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_002: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence teleapthically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

node_data.speaker: Ward Magmar
node_data.text: Another round, Stickshit.

Stickpit is collecting empty tankards from Magmar and PistleNodeContext: VO NOTE:Magmar should sound drunk

session_synopses: Two surly duergar with foul mouths order a gnome slave around. Both should sound DRUNK, loud and obnoxious as they demand a refil from the gnome. Player can assert how they feel about the enslaving of the gnome.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.
node_data.context:
NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

Clan-sen means a duergar from another clan. Pronounced like it is spelled.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Gnome leader at the Duergar Camp. He can be killed during combat either trying to escape or helping players fight Duergar first, and Nere later.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!
To my granddaughter. Shirra Clarwen. Serves Ilmater, she doth.
She waits in Wyrm's Crossing. Take me there, and thou shalt bathe in her golden gifts.
O! Thou shalt be blessed indeed. He he hee!

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *Your spirits are sky-high, and your steps unreasonably light.*
The agony of ecstasy - ha ha HEE! Why must pleasure bring such pain?

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *Your mood levels out. You have found balance.*

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: If you cared so much, you'd have cured her already.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The circle's music slows. You recognise the melody as one of shame and mourning.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The myconids will raise her husk. Life born from death - as penance.*

session_synopses.InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder: Myconid responses to seeing Thulla - the injured gnome - being killed through the dialog.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Looking into the hole, you see only darkness. It's impossible to tell how deep it goes by sight alone.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hellooo?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your call echoes as it plunges downward, before gradually fading away.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The call echoes down the hole.

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the growl of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

HangedDrow_Dead.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead.context: NodeContext: Jhaam is his name. Pronounced Zhahm.

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.HangedDrow_Dead: Player finds drow corpse hanging in a cage in Grymforge. When you click on it you discover that it was a Harper who came here, and could get some foreshadowing about Last Light and the name Jaheira.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave the True Soul to me. Now tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Lunkbug, don't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do what I can.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Our blood to fill your oceans, oh blessed BOOOAL! Our bones to build your temple in the deep!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: NodeContext: Fanatic devotion, speaking to the air/altar

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *A wave of pure devotion washes over you - and with every surge, you feel a presence grow in response.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: WORDS, PRIEST. PROMISES. YOUR GOD WANTS PROOF. WANTS BLOOD.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his god form. He should be invisible with some VFXNodeContext: DISMISSIVE, IMPATIENT

SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *These beings are kuo-toa - former mind flayer slaves that manifest their gods through sheer belief.*
CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: YOU! Our Lord of Murder demands sacrifice! You will be an offering for the great god BOOOAL!

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal is the true Lord of Murder. Perhaps I should offer you instead.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal...? No... we are... we are faithful to Lord BOOOAL...

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You sense a flicker of doubt - brief, but enough. For an instant, the godly presence falters.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: NO! NO! Stop that!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back to his common form. He is invisible for "NO! NO" and becomes visible for "Stop that!"NodeContext: Furious, panicked - his con is being exposed and he's losing power even as he speaks

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: He's a fabrication. Whatever you created him for, you don't need him.
True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ARGH! NO! SHUT IT! Shut your rotten mouth!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back into his common form. He is invisible for the capitalised parts of this now, but then becomes visible for "Shut your rotten mouth"NodeContext: The lack of faith is literally draining power from him - sulky and furious all in one as he returns to his common form

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You feel the presence waver - one moment a god of awesome power, the next... a common redcap.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Ah. Bollocks.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and he appears as a redacapNodeContext: Realising the game is up

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Don't do anything hasty, now. The fishfolk got plenty of power - we can share.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and appears as a common redcapNodeContext: Still annoyed with us but willing to make a deal. Only SLIGHTLY wheedling - redcaps aren't known for negotiating

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ... blessed Boooal... what...?

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Shut it, you!  I'm talking to... my Chosen! Chosen got power - you want power, don't ya?
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and just appears as an ordinary redcapNodeContext: Shouting his high priest down - he wants to seal the deal with us before his idiot followers fully catch on

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: I'll just kill you and claim it for myself.

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.SpeakWithBOOOAL: The player encounters a group of kuo-toa, humanoid fish beings capable of creating gods just by imagining them. They're overzealous and easily duped, and are currently worshipping a murderous redcap they've mistaken for a god of murder. He's capitalising on the situation and very much enjoying the incredible power with which he's been invested. In this dialogue, we can deal with him as this great inscrutable power, or see through the situation and expose / do a deal with him. In all cases he's brash, offensive and generally gross.The all cap lines are BOOOAL in his fully powerful form.When we suddenly rever to lower caps, it's when we've forced him into his 'common' form.BOOOAL = Boo-AHHL (almost guttural)Kuo-Toa = Koo-oh-TO-ah
session_synopses.KuoToaMinion: A  node that plays when the player tries to click on a praying kuotoa. They will either praise you as the Chosen of their madeup god, or make you a new made-up god.BOOOAL - Booh-ALMahkloompah - mak-LOOM-pah
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No more. No more pain, no more work. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: No! Too much yelling, too much pain. All must die!

Rothe_001.speaker: Player
Rothe_001.text: Breathe. Focus. If you strike, your masters will destroy the herd.

Rothe_001.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_001.text: All right. We will work. We will do as we're told. We will clear the way.

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002.speaker: Player
Rothe_002.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: Fantastic work. You're a right master of beasts.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: But ain't no one but clan need to be using the forge back there - and we can't have you blabbing!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: You tryin' to grab the adamantine back there for yourself?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: The metal and forge are the clan's - Laduguer's decree!

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: What in the hells? What's this all about?

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Adamantine is precious, jargh. And I'm not the sharing type.

session_synopses.Rothe_001: Animal dialogue - a skittish beast of burden.A deep rothe that's being used by some duergar to clear rubble - only it smells death and is unwilling to work. The player can try to calm the beast (through Speak with Animals or Animal Handling) and encourage it to calm down and return to work, or to turn against the duergar. If the player fails to calm the rothe, it will turn on both them and the duergar.
session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).
session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: I speak true, brothers! You know it in your hearts! You know it in your very souls!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Jox
FourWay.text: We need no 'Lolth' - no spider queen! Father Murmath is the head of clan Lur. He hatched us, raised us, feeds us!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: What care we for his business here? He keeps us small. Keeps us contained. We should be with the Spider Queen - revered, adored!

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Your sister speaks true. The Spider Queen would welcome you with great enthusiasm.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: You! Please - explain to my brothers - we must be among our own kind!

FourWay.speaker: Narrator
FourWay.text: *These spiders are loyal to the local duergar. In the event of a fight, they will join the fray against you - with slavering enthusiasm.*

FourWay.speaker: Player
FourWay.text: Among the Spider Queen's followers, you'd be revered as her physical manifestation. Honoured. Exalted.

FourWay.speaker: Lur Jox
FourWay.text: We owe Father Murmath all we are - and we will never betray him!

FourWay.speaker: Lur Xanta
FourWay.text: But - but the Spider Queen! Lolth! Our due!

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.FourWay: In this dialogue, Lur Xanta is trying to convince the other 3 to leave with her to join the cult of Lolth.Player can help her convince them, or fail to do so and they will attack Lur Xanta for being disloyal.This dialogue has 2 outcomes:AGGRO: Lur Jox (or another spider) attacks Lur Xanta, killing her in one shot. (via gameplay - not cine)PEACEFUL: Lur Xanta convinces the other 3 to follow her into the Underdark-- they are leaving to somewhere new.Lur Xanta is fantatical and somewhat learned. The other 3 are a bit more simple.
session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

PAD_IdolLooted.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_IdolLooted.text: An idol of Lady Shar. It's beautiful... Curious that I found it. Not the first sign of the Dark Lady's power that I've encountered.
PAD_IdolLooted.context: NodeContext: Admiring and intrigued. (SH is loyal to shar and known to worship her)

session_synopses.PAD_IdolLooted: Party loots the Idol of Shar.

node_data.speaker: Hurk
node_data.text: Been a long day for all of us, so don't try nothin' funny.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - what are those marks there?

session_synopses.PAD: The player spots a sign of Thulla's escape: footprints. Player wishes to take a closer look.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

AvatarWorsens.speaker: Narrator
AvatarWorsens.text: *Despite your efforts to stave it off, the gnawing power within you demands more magic.*
AvatarWorsens.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pained grimace. Gale's netherese orb is weakening himInternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the second time. He has consumed one magic item but that has proven insufficient.

session_synopses.AvatarWorsens: Gale Avatar - after having journeyed for a while, Gale feels weak from the bomb that exist in him.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Time to leg it out of here.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You hear another muffled cry. The two inside are still in the throes of... passion.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Open the door.

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Back away slowly.

node_data.speaker: Buthir
node_data.text: Ruined! Smash - I'll SMASH YOU!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bugbear is getting off of the ogress and glares at me, if possible, he should be a bit ruffled. The ogress is behind hin and still getting up, adjusting the clothes around her waist. it should be clear they were having sex.NodeContext: The ogress is flying into a rage.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.
session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.text: Gonna poke some extra holes in you!

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.speaker: Fezzerk

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*

Tome.speaker: Player
Tome.text: Read on and wrest the book's power from it.

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*

Tome.speaker: Narrator
Tome.text: *But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.Tome: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
session_synopses.PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome: Plays if the player tries to take DangerousBook (The Necromancy of Thay) out of their companion's inventory when the book is bound to that companion (and therefore locked to their inventory). The PAD will play and the tome won't be removed. Only valid for Astarion, Gale, who want to keep the book and won't let anyone take it from them.

Village_Trespassing.text: You sent from Moonrise, drow? 'Cos otherwise, I'll have to cut ya.

session_synopses.Village_Trespassing: This guard has come upon you sneaking through a village her force is occupying. She was bored and sees you as a potential source of fun (ie, someone to murder/bully).  Defaulting to she, but numerous goblins could deliver this dialogue as it's a dynamic crime one.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You seem a little confused.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a little far from home for a deep gnome.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Ignorance is alive and well, it seems! Deep gnomes aren't restricted to the Underdark, you know - I've lived in Baldur's Gate for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Testily

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. He had this locket, see, that I gave him years ago before leaving home.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in Baldur's Gate. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I always help my friends.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He says his goodbyes, turns and walks away

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed: After being let off the pane of the windmill.

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player

True

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *You see a name etched into the leather - 'Scratch'.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closer look at the dog's neck (collar/tag doesn't necessarily have to be legible when combined with the narration)

session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

AfterSummon.speaker: Lump the Enlightened

session_synopses.AfterSummon: You have agreed to summon ogres up to three times for the to help you in battle. These are the leader's conversation with you each time. THis is... complicated because there could be many deals in play.

LastCub.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cub looks from dead mother to the player, wailing.NodeContext: Narrator node!

node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

node_data.text: What's this? Something weak, something tender...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing up the player.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: I'll tear you in half before you touch a feather on his head.

PAD_KilledByGoblins.speaker: Player
PAD_KilledByGoblins.text: Looks like the goblins found her.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player

CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: A lone cub isn't much of a threat...

VB_LastCub.speaker: Player
VB_LastCub.text: Not without its mother by its side. What now?

session_synopses.LastCub: In SwA, this cub speaks in short bursts - he sounds staccato, vicious.The player has killed an owlbear - a large, predatory wild animal. The owlbear's cub remains however, and lingers by his dead mother. The player can decide whether to put the cub out of its misery, or else leave it. If the player has the speak with animals skill, they get some additional insight into the cub's anxiety. If the player lets the cub live, it will proceed to eat its mother - it's still a wild animal, after all.
session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.PAD_KilledByGoblins: a Voicebark to make it more clear that a band of goblins came and killed the owlbear after the players have seen the owlbear but left the cave with her alive.
session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.
session_synopses.CMB_Enrage: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - in this dialogue specifically, she is enraged.Players encounter an owlbear mother and her cub in a cave. This dialogue plays if players smash her egg or kill her cub in front of her.
session_synopses.VB_LastCub: After killing an adult owlbear, combat ends as the player notes that the surviving owlbear cub doesn't pose much of a threat to them.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.text: Hang on, Ed. You're going to be all right.
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: One of the cult acolytes vocalises what both of them are thinking: the comrade they're praying for looks on the verge of death.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The first acolyte clings to his faith. Easier than planning a contingency.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The second acolyte continues to press her point, uncertain of what comes next for them.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.text: You're all right, Ed. You're all right.
AD_Cultists.context: NodeContext: The first acolyte loses his patience. Prayer is the best strategy he has for now - he wasn't expecting to have to call the shots.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.AD_Cultists: A brother and sister are worried, trying to figure out how to help their older brother (True Soul) Edowin. He's quickly fading. They are lost and lone, but haven't lost faith in the Absolute.
session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Tut tut. No need for that crude cutlery of yours. As you can see, I'm amply provisioned.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.NodeContext: He gestures across the table: plenty of silverware present.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: This is the House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_TakePlans: Player reads the blueprints of an incredible weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

Goblin_01.speaker: Tracker Slice
Goblin_01.text: Just scraping up some pieces, majesty. Don't mind me.

session_synopses.Goblin_01: A goblin is looting a house in Moonhaven. If interrupted, the goblin is grumpy to anyone but a drow.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
node_data.text: What do ya want? I'm not the one in charge.

session_synopses: A goblin raider, part of a patrol roaming the forest. Currently tormenting a deep gnome prisoner by tying him to a windmill. If the player gets too close, the goblin turns hostile - unless the player is a drow, in which case the goblin is servile.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.
session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_TrapStart.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.
session_synopses.VB_TrapStart: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Wait! Please - don't leave us. What should we do now...?
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Clingy. The cult novice pleads for orders from the player, whom he believes to be a superior.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Heartbroken. Her other brother died in the owlbear fight. Trying to hold it together.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: He's... with Edowin now, right? He's with the Absolute.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Perhaps. Who truly knows the ways of our god?

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: I suppose... I suppose the Absolute keeps some mysteries from us all.
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying very hard not to cry.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: What would you have of me now, True Soul?
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Trying to rally. Trying to be brave.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist002_InCave.text: Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.text: Edowin told us there was a camp of faithful goblins nearby. It'll do me good to be among allies.

Cultist002_InCave.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_InCave.context: NodeContext: Saying goodbye to the player. She means it.

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.Cultist002_InCave: Novice Brynna. a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by hersupposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. She reacts to the monster's presence before attacking it, then seeks orders from the player once it is dead.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

PAD_NoticeShrine.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeShrine.text: Over there - a shrine to Selûne. By Moonmaiden's grace.
