It would also be cool if he could somehow interact with the corpse on the ground by pointing at it or sneering down at it.NodeContext: This goblin is in the  telling a story to the other goblins. We join the conversation in the middle.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Tiny
node_data.text: Oh ho, you got 'im good!
node_data.context: NodeContext: praising her boss.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: And who're you? 'Nother pest? Everyone just barges in here, thinkin' they rule the world. Hah!
node_data.context: NodeContext: displeased

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't just think so; it's a fact. You're nothing but dirt beneath my feet.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Well, not us. Things're changin'. We got the Absolute on our side now.
node_data.context: NodeContext: goblin is going to show he's the boss now.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Ya better learn yer place.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's coming up with a suitable punishment for the player's arrogance and enjoying it.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Go on: kiss my foot.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He grins and plants his foot forward, nodding at it.NodeContext: bullying the player, he feels like they won't dare to refuse.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Or I'll wipe that nasty look right off yer face.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's challenging you. He fully believes you'll have to do it because he thinks he'll beat your ass.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: End him or leave him. But don't you dare grovel to this slug.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How about you kiss my feet instead?
True

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Errgh... look, mate. Just piss off. You're not welcome 'ere.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin takes a step back, looks at your weapons, and turns away.NodeContext: We intimidated him, he's trying to shrug us off.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Not so high and mighty, after all.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Don't push it, worm. I can still bash yer face in. Yeah, I think I will.
node_data.context: NodeContext: very displeased.

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: You new 'ere? You look new. Strange... weird-like. For a goblin. 'S why you don't know, right?

Friend0.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
Friend0.text: I'll tell you somethin', right? Just for you. Don't upset Crusher. He'll... you know... crush.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe. She actually wants to kiss his feet as well, but doesn't want to let it show yet.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: What was it like? Just... just curious.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's in awe and a little jealous. She wants him to kiss her feet/to kiss his feet as well.

Friend1.speaker: Player
Friend1.text: Well, it didn't smell as bad as I thought it would - more like lavender.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: Oh, don't worry 'bout the smell. 'S that magic ring 'e wears. Some kinda stupid side effect.
Friend1.context: NodeContext: She's making a side comment.

Friend1.speaker: Tracker Kirz
Friend1.text: But the foot itself, it looked craggy, didn't it? Rugged? Big? I get excited just thinkin' about it...
Friend1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin shudders, then turns to stare wistfully into space.NodeContext: excited

session_synopses: Annoyed at being interrupted while he's telling a story over a beer, this goblin wants to humiliate you in front of his lackeys.
session_synopses.Friend0: Goblin listening to another goblin's stories. He is very drunk and should be slurring his words.
session_synopses.Friend1: Goblin standing next to Crusher. She's got a crush on him.
session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

Backup_01.speaker: Tracker Fezk
Backup_01.text: 'S good you ain't causin' trouble. Boss means business, now he's got the Absolute in his ear.
Backup_01.context: NodeContext: Tone of false threat - they've been handed a position of meagre authority and are trying to lord it over you.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.Backup_01: This guard is lowly backup, but eager to lord a position of authority over anyone they can.
session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: There! That's the last frothing innard catalogued.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: investigating dead goblins - pleased to meet the perpetraror of the masscare

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Best not to hang around. Whoever is responsible for this mess may still be here... unless this was your doing?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: polite advice on first sentence, and then a warning. The final phrase is a mixture of curiosity and awe

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: You? Why? And how? But wait, wait - let me get a fresh quill. Now. You were saying?
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: preparing to take notes like an inquisitive journalist at a crime scene

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Never mind. What are you doing here anyway - looting corpses?

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Just nosing out the facts. Something happened here, and it's my job - my calling - to discover what.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: arrogant - his 'calling' (at this moment, asking annoying questions) is the most important thing in the world as far as he sees it

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: But if you won't tell me, no matter. A truth is second best to the truth.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: journalistic type who is more interested in a good story than a true story

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: Hmmm... Your story may be relevant, but the stench of this place is hardly suited to civilised conversation.
Volo_Massacre.context: NodeContext: politely trying to tag along with the players

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I wonder if we might continue this elsewhere. You've a brain I'd like to pick.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Player
Volo_Massacre.text: Pick a different brain. I can't help you.

Volo_Massacre.speaker: Volo
Volo_Massacre.text: I'll be no trouble, my friend. Name a location and I'd be happy to meet you there.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

session_synopses.Volo_Massacre: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_01: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: How you doing, pal? Looking for some odds and ends? I've scavenged all sorts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly, like a cheeky bloke at a market selling stolen goods

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are the rest of the goblins?

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: On their way to Moonrise, with her ladyship. They left me here to make sure we ain't left nothing valuable behind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: The druid Halsin is in here somewhere.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: Let's hope we find him in one piece.

session_synopses.PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp: Thematically, this VB is a conversation about the goblin camp and how difficult it might be to find the druid there. Player will be aware that he's being held captive somewhere in the camp and can see the goblins's strength.This occurs over walking into a trigger, so lines between speaker 1 and speaker 2 can be fairly opinionated.

PAD_Fled.speaker: Player
PAD_Fled.text: Where has she gone, I wonder?

session_synopses.PAD_Fled: In the top node player has started combat with the hag in the teahouse. She has disappeared, fleeing to her lair. In the bottom, business has been conducted peacefully and she has left.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband turned into summon, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband killed by players, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: Why did you come to the teahouse?

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: Ethel... bring husband... bring back... my Connor.

PAD_FireplaceIllusion.speaker: Player
PAD_FireplaceIllusion.text: Fireplace isn't real. What's hidden behind it?

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

AD_HusbandGrave.speaker: Player
AD_HusbandGrave.text: 'Here lies Connor - beloved husband, and a tasty little morsel to boot.'
AD_HusbandGrave.context: NodeContext: Above a gravestone - a cruel jab.

StartScene.text: I don't want a crumb left on that plate, girl.
StartScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Standing, Mayrina sets a plate down on the table, pie still on itNodeContext: Cheerful granny voice - you're merrily ordering Mayrina about

StartScene.speaker: Mayrina
StartScene.text: Auntie Ethel, please. One more bite and this pie is gonna come back up to say hello.
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Trying to stick up for yourself but a touch of fear in your voice. You know she's a hag and you should do as she says but you feel nauseous and sick.

StartScene.text: Don't make me get the wooden spoon. You're eating for two, so get to it!
StartScene.context: InternalNodeContext: Next node - sees player.NodeContext: A cheery rhythm to your voice even at the steel to your tone. You will be obeyed.

StartScene.text: Who is this? A friend of yours?
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Looks up and see the player. Looks from Mayrina to the player - cautious but not worried. You don't know why the player is.

StartScene.speaker: Mayrina
StartScene.text: No! No, I don't know them.
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Panic. You don't want to get in trouble

StartScene.text: Come now - aren't you going to introduce yourself?
StartScene.context: NodeContext: Slight smile as your turn your sights on the player. You're more cheerful now.

StartScene.speaker: Player
StartScene.text: Usually people ask what, as opposed to who, I am.
That's because most people are afraid of their own bloody shadows. Not me, though. Auntie Ethel welcomes everyone.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: I dragged my husband here in a wheelbarrow. Buried him. Took everything the hag threw at  me for him.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: And some godsdamned psychopath digs him up? I hate this place. I hate everyone.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.PAD_FireplaceIllusion: This triggers near the fireplace in the hag's home. If you see through the illusion, you realise that there is a passage way behind it. Otherwise you just see a pleasant fire.
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.
session_synopses.AD_HusbandGrave: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.
session_synopses.StartScene: This is the main hag dialogue. In it, you can ask about Mayrina (who is present) or make a deal to have your parasite removed. If you keep asking about Mayrina (twice), the hag will be furious and vanish Mayrina away while she deals with the 'busybody' - the player.If you agree to the tadpole deal, you must give up an eye (in the transformed dialogue).
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *A diminutive creature sporting a red hat glares at you.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *You recognise the redcap - a fey creature known for its bloodlust.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Redcap Blood Sage, Redcap, Redcap Blood Sage, 0446e7c4-3076-415c-aa7f-deb7f43e5d06, Redcap, a72e6051-d06b-469c-b6dc-4c962cfe307f
IllusionRedcap.context: CinematicNodeContext: The redcap doesn't know his illusion has failed - glaring in rage at the playerNodeContext: You don't know your illusion has failed - as far as you know, you're still a sheep. Consider making this 'sheep noise' beneath you - animalistic and rage filled as you hiss out a 'Baaa'

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *That noise. Is the creature pretending to be a... sheep?*

session_synopses.IllusionRedcap:
This occurs in the swamp. Sheep wander the area - except they're redcaps (a type of violent faerie) hidden by the hag's illusions. The creatures are pretending to be sheep. 
The illusion can be shattered by an animal handling check. OR if the player preciously succeeded in a perception check in the area.

Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack.text: The hag's doing. It has to be.

session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack: The Player has forced Lorin, the prescient victim, out of his corner in the hag lair. He begs Ethel for mercy, then clutches his chest as he dies of a heart attack - punishment for leaving his post.

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

Brother_002_AD_Fallback.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

AD_HagDisappear.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

AD_Argument.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument.text: She went to see you. We know she did.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

AD_Argument.text: You know absolutely nothing, you eejit.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Said with a laugh as your shrug the accusations off.

AD_Argument.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Voice rising. You're getting more angry and you're tired of Ethel dodging your accusations.

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: Your brother has died in front of you.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.Brother_002_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.AD_HagDisappear: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.
session_synopses.AD_Argument: This argument is the beginning of the situation. The three of them are yelling at each other out in the open. The brothers believe Ethel has taken their sister, while she is denying any knowledge of the girl.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Someone cut these men to pieces. I doubt they had time to scream.
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.context: InternalNodeContext: No idea who brothers are

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

AD_Frog.speaker: Addled Frog
AD_Frog.context: NodeContext: Cheerful. Calling out to player. Onw to 'present.'

session_synopses.AD_Frog: This is a frog in the hag's swamp. When the hag is not defeated she is fighting the hag's control - hissing and ribbiting in pain as she struggles not to hurt anyone.When the hag is defeated, she is cheerfully ribbiting as she hops about the swamp.In the top two nodes, she is showing the player a stash of loot as a reward for freeing her from the hag. Only available with SwA.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The chest's clearly worth a lot to the Zhentarim, if it's returned unopened.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: It's our chest now. We can do whatever we want with it.

session_synopses.PAD: This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Stop staring, start helping!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Less angry and more annoyed, actually.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Grand Duke Ravengard could be inside! Don't just stand there - push!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent and focused; slightly annoyed with PC.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Push against the wreckage.
False

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Damn. Find another way inside!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressing the whole groupNodeContext: Disgusted, unimpressed with PC

PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.speaker: Player
PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.text: They do seem a bit short-handed.

session_synopses: A group of Flaming Fists are trying to force a way into the burning inn at Waukeen's Rest. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be Grand Duke Ravengard, who they had been sent to protect.
session_synopses.PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon: The player has just told a Flaming Fist guard that Zhentarim are hiding in a nearby cave. The guard brushes it off because they don't have the numbers to take on a Zhent stronghold.

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: Are we really going to hunt a devil on their behalf?

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.

session_synopses.PAD_RefugeesAreCultists: Reflection dialog that plays after discovering that the paladins hunting Karlach made a deal with the arch-devil Zariel. The party reflects on whether these people deserve to be punished for dealing with a devil, or whether we should help them.Speaker 1 has agreed to help them. Speaker 2 comments on th is decision. Karlach cannot take part in this dialog.

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: If you want to go poking around in the cellar, be my guest. Plug your nose first though.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Turning her attention from a trapdoor to the player. With a smirk on the last sentence

002_PostEA.speaker: Player
002_PostEA.text: This is a nice place to hole up in. What is it?

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: It was a tollhouse. By the time we arrived, it was more like a slaughterhouse.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - explaining a reality of the world

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: There's more monsters than coin moving down this road.

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Need any supplies? We've fewer mouths to feed now.
003_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Friendly, with a hint of regret - that 'one less mouth to feed' is dead in the next room

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Two. Both stalwarts of Tyr, sworn to uphold justice.

003_PostEA.speaker: Player
003_PostEA.text: I'll take those supplies now - and everything else you own.

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Oh, you fool. We'll destroy you.

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Refugee
Dead_PostEA.text: ... infernal... servant... so long I've forgotten... why...

session_synopses.002_PostEA: Wary and abrupt. Disguised as a noble paladin of Tyr, this young is actually in league with the archdevil Zariel. She's hiding out in a tollhouse with her companions.
session_synopses.003_PostEA:
One of a group of refugees who sold their souls to the archdevil Zariel in exchange for the strength to survive their journey to Baldur's Gate. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters, and if they do their souls will be their own again.

This refugee is confident of her chances of survival, but unnerved by the pact they signed.
session_synopses.Dead_PostEA: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting speak with dead on a corpse that fell from a platform above

Dead.speaker: Dead Toll Collector
Dead.context: NodeContext: a speaking corpse telling us its name and job

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue with tollhouse worker, initiated when talking to corpse that has fallen down cliffside outside tollhouse. There is a key near the corpse that can be found through perception check or in this dialogue.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: What does godmeat taste like? I... I gotta know.

AD_CommandToAttack.speaker: Flind
AD_CommandToAttack.context: NodeContext: a howl in Abyssal - a nasty demon language

Flind_Wounded_AD.speaker: Flind
Flind_Wounded_AD.context: NodeContext: Gnoll idles - SFX only - A gutteral, demonic roar.

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.AD_CommandToAttack: The Flind commands her gnolls to attack the cave.
session_synopses.GnollRanger04_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls fest on dead Zhentarim agent's body. Cackle and growl as with other gnolls, crunching is bones cracking as it eats the corpse, 'chew' is as it devours flesh,
session_synopses.GnollRanger02_AD: A gnoll standing near a cave entrance with the rest of its pack. Idle SFX as it growls, barks etc
session_synopses.GnollRanger03_AD_Angry: Gnoll gnashes angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.Flind_Wounded_AD: Flind gnoll one-shot AD, when it is first heavily wounded or realy really angry.

session_synopses.PAD: The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Cut it out. There's worse than gnolls out there.
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: admonishing a companion, but in a friendly way

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: Nothing we need to worry about.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: How about a dragon? Would that worry you?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: trying to get a rise out of a companion

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: I'd give it a bloody good fight, that's for sure.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Ha! Only thing you'd give a dragon is bad gas.

AD_RefugeeGreeting.speaker: Anders
AD_RefugeeGreeting.text: At ease, friend. You're welcome to rest here.
AD_RefugeeGreeting.context: NodeContext: warm greeting as players enter a building where this man's companions are resting

session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Dialogue between two refugees who are secretly cultists of Zariel. This dialogue is spoken before the player enters the tollhouse where they are hiding out. If a player enters during the dialogue, they stop talking to address the newcomer.
session_synopses.AD_RefugeeGreeting: A warm greeting as players enter the tollhouse controlled by the faux-paladin's group

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_Growling: After hyena sees the player and growls before running away to call gnolls to attack.

session_synopses.AD_Working:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: The fire - hurry! Get this thing off of me!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stuck under wooden beamNodeContext: Panicking, wheezing/coughing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Find leverage to shift the beam.
True

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: I think... that's it!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player pushes against the beam. Benryn wriggles out and stands.

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: Almost... there!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts the beam a couple of inches. He rolls out from under the beam on "There". Player drops it after he's free.

PAD_Door.speaker: Player
PAD_Door.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

AD_Freed.speaker: Benryn
AD_Freed.context: NodeContext: He's just barely escaped a burning building with his life, only to emerge into the remains of a bloodbath.

PAD_FoundWife.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundWife.text: Green blouse, brown hair - that must be Miri.
PAD_FoundWife.context: NodeContext: Names pronounced Ben-rin and MIH-ree

PAD_FoundWife.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundWife.context: NodeContext: Names pronounced Ben-rin and Mih-rih

session_synopses:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
session_synopses.AD: This AD plays when Benryn is stuck beneath a fallen beam within a burning building. He is crying out for help - but coughing as he does so, as the building is still on fire.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.
session_synopses.AD_Freed: This AD plays after the player has freed Benryn from beneath a fallen beam. The building they're in is burning around them - he's desperate to escape.
session_synopses.AD_Escaping: This AD plays after Benryn has been rescued and has subsequently joined the party. They are within a  burning building. Once players safely exit the building, Benryn leaves the party and further dialogues become available.In this dialogue, Benryn is
session_synopses.PAD_FoundWife: This VB plays when players near the body of Benryn's wife, Mirileth. Benryn has told them what she looks like - brown hair, green dress - and this body fits the description.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.context: NodeContext: Polited but panicked - he's a hostage and by talking to him, we risk making his captors angry

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: I'm far too busy to speak. Goodbye!
DoubtingArtist.context: NodeContext: Pretending all is well, really trying to get rid of us

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax. I'm just here to trade.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Quite. Now I really do have to get back to work!
DoubtingArtist.context: NodeContext: Nodding along, panicked, loud, and clearly not listening. Just wants us to move on.

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I'm told we're taking a stroll through the Underdark once we blow the charges.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Let me guess. You'd rather take the surface.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: The route with fewer hook horrors and other beasties? Perish the thought.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: How did a coward like you survive all these years in the Network?

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Dog_03.speaker: Istor
Dog_03.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.text: Shitting hells, will this never end?!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been freed by the player, He is leaving the cave, but on the path he feels threatened by something

Zhent05.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05.text: You seem a nice sort - I'm glad we didn't have to kill you.

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Our visitor's taking out the lights! Fall back!

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: Look - there's no need for this. Free me now and I'll see that my patron rewards you!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: He's trying to get the attention of his captors, trying to be personable and bargain his way free

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: I need only tell her it's a gambling debt - it's happened before!

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: Wouldn't linger down here, I were you - see all that smokepowder?

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: The Flaming Fist won't find nothing here but rubble.

Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent04.text: You don't want to keep Zarys waiting, believe me.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Zhent07_AD.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD.text: Be just my luck to have the barrels go off in this damp.

Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.text: Run! Rugan's friend set off the traps!

AD_InvestigationCheck2.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck2.text: Locked. Best find another way in.

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Welcome: Garias is guarding a lowly gang hideout. ADs as he approaches you to open the door.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent05: Bellar is a common thug working for the Zhent. We can find him beating one of their own members for incompetence, or waiting to flee the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.VB_Cellar: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle: Doubting artist has been kidnapped and is now enslaved by Zhentarim. Everything is peaceful around, for now.
session_synopses.Zhent08: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04: Garias is a lowly Zhent recruit left with guarding the gate. He's sullen about it.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD: Vol is guarding a storeroom down in a cave and is very bored.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated: Plays if the player sets off the explosives after winning the Zhent over.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck2: Player passes investigation check to discover hidden door, but it's locked.

VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.speaker: Player
VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow.text: An unlikely place for such a fortunate find.

Sign_PAD.speaker: Player
Sign_PAD.text:
'Welcome to Waukeen's Rest.
West - Baldur's Gate. East - Elturel.'
Sign_PAD.context: NodeContext: The player is reading from a signpost. Pronunciation: Wah-KEEN, ELL-tur-ELL

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: You're a medium! You're going to speak to her.

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Could you ask her something for me?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: Maybe. What do you want me to ask?

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: The dowry. She'd know where it is.
DeadCiv1_Dead.context: NodeContext: Having an 'aha' moment (but not excited - he's still grieving)

DeadCiv1_Dead.speaker: Benryn
DeadCiv1_Dead.text: It's for her sister's wedding. Miri had it when she ran out.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow: Party with drow in it comes upon a dead drow and comments on the armour. The second speaker is always a Dr
session_synopses.Sign_PAD: The player is reading from a signpost in front of the tavern 'Waukeen's Rest'.
session_synopses.DeadFF1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.
session_synopses.DeadCiv1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a civilian that was caught in the middle. She stopped in Wakeen's Rest with her husband and daughter in the middle of their journey to Waterdeep for a wedding. She watched her family butchered by goblins before being killed herself.
session_synopses.DeadDrow1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the drow raiders. He was killed by a Flaming Fist archer perched atop the inn.

session_synopses.AD_FloorCollapse: A piece of the floor of the room in which Desire is trapped just collapsed.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: ... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Don't follow me - find your own way.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Seems you have good survival instincts - maybe you should join me instead.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I go my own way. Alone.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the githyanki's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Play along as a gith. Say you're indeed from the crèche.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.context: NodeContext: Tir'su: the githanki alphabet. Pronounced TEAR-soo.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate, then to Lae'zel.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A mystical map glows before Lae'zel, revealing a githyanki refuge beyond the mountain pass.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *The slate also reveals the githyanki's purpose: they are combing the Sword Coast in search of a polyhedric relic of great importance to their queen.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: The map is clear - I will soon reach a githyanki crèche. It lies within an ancient temple at the mountain pass.

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: I must hurry forth. Purification is at hand.

Sign_AD.speaker: Narrator
Sign_AD.text: *Baldur's Gate: Northwest. Elturel: South. Moonrise Towers: West.*

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: Still warm to the touch, if you can believe it.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: A dragon is clearly not to be trifled with.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.text: I should have ended you when I had the chance.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.context: InternalNodeContext: She was never a companion

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_Shield: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelSidesWithGith: |Player manually attacked the githyanki, bypassing the normal flow. Lae'zel is still a NPC. She sides with the githyanki in this combat.|

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: We shouldn't stay too long. The goblins might come back.
AwayFromCorpse.context: NodeContext: He's politely telling the player to go away.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Player
AwayFromCorpse.text: All these people... how many did you lose?

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: The whole guard. Every last one of them.

AwayFromCorpse.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
AwayFromCorpse.text: They were cut down like animals. It's senseless.

session_synopses.AwayFromCorpse: A Flaming Fist soldier standing in the aftermath of a drow raid on an inn. There were many casualties, and it's hitting him hard.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: These bones are ancient. I wonder who they were.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: There are Harper and druid symbols on their equipment - an interesting pair.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

AD_001.speaker: Narrator
AD_001.text: *Risen Road. Closed due to inclement weather. Seek marked detour.*

session_synopses.AD_001: Sign before the Risen Road detour around SCL.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: The tracks converge here. Two, maybe three drow. At least one of ours.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Kneeling>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: From here they went... Damn! It's all so confused.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dain goes from kneeling to standing on "It's all so confused" - looking at the tracks on the ground in confusion

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're the one who seems confused.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: I'm not confused, I'm frustrated.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: These tracks should be able to tell us everything that happened here.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: But I can't piece together much, thanks to the fire.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Have you figured anything out?

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: Nothing I didn't already know.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: Drow and goblins raided the inn and burned it to the ground.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: I'm trying to find out where they took the - what they came for.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm a guard from a nearby village. I'm here to offer my assistance.
False

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: There aren't any villages within a day's walk.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Narrows her eyes suspiciously.NodeContext: <Standing>

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
node_data.text: I'll blame your little lie on simple curiosity. This time.
node_data.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Emphasis on 'simple' - she's calling the player stupid.

session_synopses: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If the other Flaming Fists find a way inside, she stops to watch. After Desire escapes and the inn is burnt down, she investigates the area, kneeling and inspecting tracks.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.text: Ah, Rugan... old bastard thought he'd live forever.
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: NodeContext: wry comment on the death of a companion... sad, but pragmatic

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: There's nothing in there that'll help - leave it!
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Quiet conversation(?) - the afraid of the gnolls and don't want to provoke them

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: If we don't deal with them gnolls, none of us are getting out of here alive.
Agent_001_Cave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Showing the gnolls at the entrance of the cave.NodeContext: Urgency, panic

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave.text: One of us is getting out of here richer - I don't fight for free.
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Could make a non-persuasion node (auto-success)

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Fine. Money's useless to dead men.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: Offering to pay for our help. Abrupt - wants to get this out of the way

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Damn it... must have dropped my purse.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: patting down his pockets, confused

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Get us out of this, and I swear we'll make it worth your while.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Someone must have found the wagon by now.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, doesn't really believe this

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Only if whoever found the wagon is stupid enough to fight a pack of gnolls.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: preparing to let someone down

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: So, no. I think help's a long way from here.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, speaking a harsh truth

Agent_001_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_001_Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a speak with dead spell

Agent_001_Dead.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Dead.context: NodeContext: a corpse speaking through a spell - dispassionate, cryptic

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for Olly after he fought gnolls and is the only agent who survived.
session_synopses.Agent_001_Cave: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_001_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Rugan.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse after casting a speak with dead spell on it

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue initiated when speaking to the decomposing corpse of a toll collector found in an abandoned tollhouse basement

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A human man awaits you, a spell crackling at his fingertips.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: [Salazon is crouching behind the shelves with Fire Bolt ready].

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A human man awaits you, a spell crackling at his fingertips.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: [Salazon is crouching behind the shelves with Fire Bolt ready].

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait - listen!
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He freezes, waiting on your next word.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Careful. You won't kill me, but you will make me mad.
True

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: Right, look - if it's business you're about, then be about it. Flaming Fist could be on us any minute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Salazon stands up. We've intimidated him but he's trying to cling on to some scrap of authority, letting us down with a warning as if it's his choice.

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: Down you go - entrance is behind the wardrobe. You'll find a key in one of the crates.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wardrobe is behind SalazonNodeContext: [Salazon is standing].

Permitted.speaker: Salazon
Permitted.text: Said you could pass, didn't I?
Permitted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Salazon is crouching behind shelves, focused on the entrance. Impatient, wanting to get back to his taskNodeContext: Salazon is crouching behind shelves, focused on the entrance. Impatient, wanting to get back to his task

session_synopses: Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *The beautiful broken heap smells oddly enticing. You find you can't resist inhaling her offals.*
DeathEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena is trying to drag herself to the player, but cannot due to the weight in her stomach.

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *You hear what comes next before you see it: the sharp snapping of bones and a yelp of pain as her body starts to twist and undulate.*

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *You watch with cold realisation - this isn't the end of one life, but the start of another...*

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator
DeathEvent.text: *...Gnolls - vicious, monstrous humanoids - can spawn from the corpses of dying hyenas.*

DeathEvent.speaker: Player
DeathEvent.text: Show mercy, ending her life swiftly.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: I'd prefer not to see it again, that's for sure.

VB_PostFight_3P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_3P.text: Best to move before the blood draws more of them.

session_synopses.DeathEvent: The player encounters a dying hyena that is about to turn into a gnoll. If they discover this in time, they can try to stop the gnoll from being born. Otherwise, the gnoll is born and attacks the player when the dialogue ends.
session_synopses.VB_PostFight_3P: Three players have just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas.
session_synopses.04: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.

PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.text: There's a pressure plate in the chair, but I'm missing something.

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA.context: InternalNodeContext: In this iteration, the player has killed all the tieflings in the grove before meeting Karlach. She will not join the player but she may be convinced not to attack them.NodeContext: Cold rage.

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA.text: I know what you did. All those people in the druid's grove - you slaughtered them to a man.

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA.text: Did it make you feel important, huh? Did it make you feel big?

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA.text: The last person you're ever going to meet. Karlach's my name. I've got a knack for killing demons and devils, and I think I found my next target.

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA.text: Please - more violence won't change the past. Leave me be, and I'll leave you too.

Karlach_PostEA.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA.text: You're right. Violence won't change the past. But the right kind of violence can protect the future. You're dangerous. I can't let you leave.

AD_KarlachWounded.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachWounded.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself as she tends to a wound

AD_KarlachHealed.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachHealed.text: Thanks. That was really starting to hurt.

HeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot.text: *A faint, acrid smell clings to the corpse - like the memory of a storm.*
HeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Karlach's dead body.

HeadLoot.text: CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but maybe show either a reaction shot as they prepare to decapitate
HeadLoot.context: CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but maybe show either a reaction shot as they prepare to decapitate

HeadLoot.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot.text: *The head comes free with a sickening crunch.*

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate: A character reacts when sitting on one of the stone chairs in the tollhouse basement and activating the pressure plate hidden there. There is an audible click, but a second character needs to be in the other chair to open the secret chamber. The line needs to hint that there is a second part to solving the puzzle.
session_synopses.Karlach_PostEA: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.
session_synopses.AD_KarlachWounded: Karlach's ADs as she tends to a wound inflicted by the false paladins.
session_synopses.AD_KarlachHealed: A wounded Karlach responds when players heal her out of dialog. She's extremely grateful.
session_synopses.HeadLoot: After killing Karlach, players have the option to study her corpse and cut off her head if they have the mission to kill her and retrieve the head.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Sarth Baretha, a mid-ranking githyanki warriorv who was ordered to search Faerûn for a mysterious stolen weapon.

AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.context: NodeContext: She's yelling from inside a burning building.

AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.text: We hear you! Stay where you are!
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.context: NodeContext: To Desire, elsewhere in the building.

AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.text: We don't have much time. Find her!
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.context: NodeContext: Barking orders to her fellow Flaming Fists.

session_synopses.AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn: Ravengard's counsellor is trapped within a burning building. The Flaming Fist is one of several that forces their way inside. She calls to them when they enter, and the FF yells back to her.

PAD_OtherWay.speaker: Player
PAD_OtherWay.text: There's got to be another way in.
PAD_OtherWay.context: NodeContext: The burning is on fire. Said with some urgency.

session_synopses.PAD_OtherWay: Player remarks that there must be a way inside the burning building if they weren't able to bust down the front door.
